TopicTitle: Care to help Me improve a simplistic design?

Articles.Content:
I originally made this rocket as a 'low lag' rocket. I\'ve kept the design the same, as in the video since i built it.

As far as showing it off here, I\'m also looking to improve it. Do you have any tips on how I can improve this design?

Looks like you need to get more fuel into orbit. My suggestion would be to add 2 more engines with 2 fuel tanks each. This will raise your thrust-to-weight ratio for the first critical portion of the flight. Have the the other two radial fuel stacks feed into these new engines and then from there to the center stack. That way, you\'ll be dumping more dry fuel tanks along with engines you don\'t need. That should leave you with a lot more fuel when you reach orbit.

Also consider shooting for a lower orbit around Kerbin. Not only will it save on fuel, but it will also save a little more fuel when doing your TMI due to the Oberth effect.

Another thing you might want to consider is adding some wings to land on. The RCS tanks like to explode.
